ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk33:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk33:1.2_0: At that time the monks from the group of six ate almsfood picking here and there. ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk33:1.3.1_0: “‘I will eat almsfood in order,’ this is how you should train.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk33:1.4_0: Almsfood is to be eaten in order.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk33:1.5_0: If a monk, out of disrespect, eats almsfood picking here and there, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk33:1.6.1_0: there is no offense for him.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk33:1.8_0: To give rise to the robe.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk33:1.11_0: if he picks things out to give to others;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk33:1.12_0: if he picks things out to put it into someone else’s vessel;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk33:1.13_0: if it is a special curry;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk33:1.16_0: if he is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk33:1.17_0: The third training rule is finished.
